Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; white slip; interior reserved; bands on edges of rim; on top, double guilloche pattern between bands; on body, dot and billet pattern between bands; below, painted decoration consisting of goat (part of head and horn remaining), to right; at right, vertical dot and billet band and vertical maeander pattern; graffito inscription on top of lip.
Producer name: Attributed to: Painter of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as University College Dublin 309. Lemos does not place this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group, but if the sherd belongs with UCD 309, then it ought to be included there alongside the UCD sherd which Lemos specifies was decorated by the Painter of the Würzburg Chalices. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices, see Lemos 1991, pls 20-1, nos 236-7. However the manner in which the goat's eye is depicted differs from those on the Würzburg chalices.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 246, no. 290)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0008) (phase 2)
